repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem: layout i.e. whitespace that is part of codelenses is currently displayed as weird symbols and large amounts of spaces

Solution: replace all consecutive whitespace symbols with a single space character when trying to display codelenses as virtual text

This closes #28794

comment_regular_data.body:
```

       > /build/d1hgm0pkhphps2f56blf4hfbjzdcjlwy-source/src/nvim/lua/treesitter.c: In function 'node_child_containing_descendant':
       > /build/d1hgm0pkhphps2f56blf4hfbjzdcjlwy-source/src/nvim/lua/treesitter.c:1095:18: error: invalid initializer
       >  1095 |   TSNode child = ts_node_child_containing_descendant(node, descendant);
       >       |                  ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
``` 
I currently get this problem when trying to build with nix, so I couldn't verify that this works yet...
Tree-sitter 0.22.6 is required; make sure Nix has the correct dependency. If you make a PR, **always** use the provided build scripts.
thank you, I was using what is in `./contrib` building locally seemed fine but I wanted to playtest with my actual config.

>  I was using what is in ./contrib

That is in contrib for a reason; it's known to be broken and slated for removal.
force pushed to make the linter happy
@clason as soon as treesitter 0.22.6 is merged to nixpkgs I also have a fix for the nix code, should that be upstreamed or do you not want that as it's going to be removed anyway?
should `news.txt` get an update with this PR or is this not "important enough"
wrt release, this is going into `0.11`? or can I expect it to land in a minor version?
Features are not backported in general, so this will be 0.11 only. (Unless it's actually a `fix`; then it will be backported. @mfussenegger will decide.)

> @clason as soon as treesitter 0.22.6 is merged to nixpkgs I also have a fix for the nix code, should that be upstreamed or do you not want that as it's going to be removed anyway?

Thank you but no thank you; it will be removed, and the upstream flake will get the fix.

comment_regular_data.body: Wow! Thank you for your work guys, this was a really cool experience to contribute, really swift and no hiccups!
